title: Video and Quiz-Based Concept Mastery Strategies for Online Mathematics Learning: Advanced Topics in Equations, Graphs, and Statistics

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental mathematics concepts (equations, functions, statistics) and experience with online learning platforms, basic computational skills and graph interpretation abilities
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment for professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields, where digital devices are provided and project-based assessments are applied. Learners are evaluated on their ability to solve domain-specific problems through mathematical modeling (regression analysis, probability distributions, proof techniques, etc.).

learning_goals: Learners will strengthen their ability to interpret linear and nonlinear graphs and first/second-degree equations by completing at least 80% of a six-minute video lecture.
Learners will verify algebraic problem-solving and numerical computation skills by passing video-based quizzes with an average accuracy of 90% or higher.
Learners will apply math concepts (functions, statistics, proofs) acquired through videos and quizzes to real-world case analyses in specialized fields (medicine, law, technology).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
